settings.ConsentPromo: I would like to receive team-boosting related information, offers, recommendations and updates from WeQ

settingsEdit.VerificationSent: Verification email sent!, Please follow the link in the email to change your email
settingsEdit.ErrorEmailSameOld: new email is the same as the old one

home.CertifiedCoach: You must be a WeQ Certified Master Coach to create a new group.

inviteGroup.GroupNamePromptText: What is the name of this group?
inviteGroup.GroupMemberPromptText: Who should be in the group?
inviteGroup.MaxNumberOfMember: Maximum amount of group member reached
inviteGroup.ErrorMaxNumberMember: Maximum amount of group member reached
inviteGroup.ErrorMinNumberMember: Each group in a WeQ session must have at least 2 players

confirmAdd.ConfirmTitle: The following actions need your confirmation
confirmAdd.EmailSendConfirmation: Email invitation will be sent to all new member(s)

confirmEdit.ConfirmTitle: The following actions need your confirmation
confirmEdit.EmailSendConfirmation: Email invitation will be sent to all new member

groupPage.PsychologicalSafetyText1: In this team, I feel like I can fail openly.
groupPage.PsychologicalSafetyText2: I know my colleagues’ positive characteristics and strengths very well.
groupPage.PsychologicalSafetyText3: In this team, I feel comfortable showing my vulnerability.
groupPage.ConstructiveFeedbackText1: In this team, members frequently exchange constructive feedback.
groupPage.ConstructiveFeedbackText2: This team regularly recognises my achievements and successes.
groupPage.ConstructiveFeedbackText3: My colleagues get easily defensive when they happen to receive criticism.
groupPage.CognitiveBiasText1: I feel that my team prefers to maintain a harmony over being disturbed by conflicts.
groupPage.CognitiveBiasText2: A high-performing team creates less errors and mistakes than those which are mediocre.
groupPage.CognitiveBiasText3: In our team, juniors regularly seek ideas from seniors.
groupPage.SocialNormsText1: In meetings, one person or a small group tends to speak most of the time.
groupPage.SocialNormsText2: In this team, members withhold information that might be useful for others.
groupPage.SocialNormsText3: This team has a strong sense of collective success rather than just personal gain.
groupPage.NoMatrixInfo: There is currently no matrix information available.

quizRankWait.OthersEvaluatingYou: Sit back and relax, the others are evaluating you.
quizRankWait.WaitForOthers: Waiting for others to be ready.
quizRankWait.TheWholeTeamWillRank: The whole team will now rank:
quizRankWait.MessageDoneLine2: Please wait until everyone in the group completes their self-ranking...

quizRankPlaceCard.Instruction: Write down the numbers on your WeQ playmat.

loadingAnimated.PleaseWaitGenerating: Please wait...WeQ is generating your card numbers.

groupQuizQuestion.HowOftenCompliment: How often did you get compliments from your colleagues in last 7 days?
groupQuizQuestion.IdealPraiseRatio: What is the ideal ratio of 'praise : criticism' at work?
groupQuizQuestion.TeamSharedGoal: In a few words, what is the shared goal of your team?
groupQuizQuestion.RankDiscussionBehaviour: An effective meeting requires certain behaviors. Rank which behaviors are most important, from top to bottom.
groupQuizQuestion.HadToChoosePrefer: If I had to choose, I would prefer to...
groupQuizQuestion.RankCriticismGiver: Criticism can be difficult to handle, depending on who gives it. Rank from top to bottom which people are the most difficult to get criticism from.
groupQuizQuestion.RankBehaviourImprovement: Which of the behaviors below would you most like to work on? Rank the answers.
groupQuizQuestion.EvaluateSession: How satisfied are you with the WeQ experience? Evaluate the session.
groupQuizQuestion.HadToChooseSomeonePrefer: If giving and getting criticism becomes so easy, who would you prefer to get it from?
groupQuizQuestion.WhenReceivingCriticism: When receiving criticism during the session… (rate the statements)

groupQuizAnswer.Answer3A: Begin meetings with business right away.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3B: Be sure members take equal turns during meetings.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3C: It's often necessary to cut people off when they are talking.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3D: Disagreements in the meeting should be minimized.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer3E: Leaders at the meeting should speak first, and guide the discussion.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer4: Give a difficult and unpleasant criticism.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer4A: Receive a difficult and unpleasant criticism.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6: In meetings, I'll try to talk a bit less.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6A: I'll work more toward the success of the team than for my personal gain.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6B: I'll speak up more about problems and issues, and not fear being judged by others.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6C: I'll give more compliments to my peers.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer6D: I'll try to not be defensive when my colleagues criticise me.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7: I felt safe speaking up my mind.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7A: I discussed things that I usually don't share with my team.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7B: I gave and received some constructive feedback.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7C: I learned some new, positive attributes of my colleagues.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7D: The way we handle communication during the session was more effective than our usual team meetings.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer7E: I see the value of these 'we-time' sessions and would recommend it to others.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer9A: I sometimes felt I'm being punished.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer9B: I sometimes worried that I’m offending the other person.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer9C: I recognized my colleagues want to help me improve.
groupQuizAnswer.Answer9D: I received insightful information that helps me improve.

sweetAlert.SelectSelf: I see what you want. It’s natural to be ego-centric 🙂.  But let’s counteract our biases. Think about your colleagues first.

gamePlayPage.InstructionLine1: Go to quiz section to reflect on your feedback experience.
gamePlayPage.InstructionLine2: Once you're done with the quizzes, you may continue the next round.

personTurnPage.InstructionPraiseLine2: everyone in group will choose which card is more applicable to
personTurnPage.InstructionCriticismLine1: everyone in group will choose which card is more applicable to
personTurnPage.InstructionResultLine1: : Ask 2 people to explain their choice, and mostly listen to the feedback.

welcomePage.InstructionPraiseLine1: turn over and read cards 3 and 4.
welcomePage.InstructionPraiseLine2: this may be difficult, but you must choose the card that you think is more applicable to
welcomePage.InstructionCriticismLine1: choose which of these cards is something you think

chooseCard.InstructionSelfPraiseLine1: Read your cards 3 & 4 which one suits

chooseCardPage.PleaseWaitNextTurn: Please wait until next turn starts.
chooseCardPage.OthersSelectingForYouLine1: others are now selecting card for you.
chooseCardPage.EveryoneHasPickedForYouLine1: Everyone has picked a card for you.
chooseCardPage.EveryoneHasPickedForYouLine2: Please wait until next turn starts.
